p: In relation to other Podocarpus species that have been analysed under future change scenarios and genetic characteristics, the work of Mellick et al. [ 66] on Podocarpus elatus (east coast of Australia) also shows evidence of a change in range, where northern populations would move further north and south, and southern populations would be reduced in size and confined to a small portion of the south coast. Therefore, Podocarpus species are susceptible to climate change and at least in the past, have been able to trace their optimum. It will be a challenge for the future to keep pace with climate change.
